alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Kennebec; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .Considerable flash flooding has occurred across the area. This has resulted in numerous road closures and debris on roadways. While flood waters recede, area roads may be compromised. Continue to heed all road closures and be alert for remaining standing water at night. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall has occurred. * WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest, and western Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in poor drainage areas and washed out roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 854 PM EDT, emergency management reported numerous road closures in the advisory area due to damage from floods. - Heavy rain has ended across the area. However, North Jay, Jay, Beans Corner, Wilton, Chesterville, Canton, and Farmington are the most likely place to experience ongoing road closures and standing water. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Jay, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, Canton, Wilton, Livermore, Chesterville, Vienna and New Sharon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded or closed roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
